parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The tongue; by implication, a language.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From prophetes; to foretell events, divine, speak under inspiration, exercise the prophetic office.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From prophetes; to foretell events, divine, speak under inspiration, exercise the prophetic office.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The tongue; by implication, a language.
From ek; the exterior; figuratively aside from, besides.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To translate, interpret, explain. From dia and hermeneuo; to explain thoroughly, by implication, to translate.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
Feminine of a compound of oikos and the base of doma; architecture, i.e. a structure; figuratively, confirmation.
